name: overview
title: Full PINGR tutorial
description: Start from the beginning and learn everything about how to use PINGR.

legs.title: Navigation
paragraphs: With these tabs you can access other panels in the system. In general you will move from left (overview panel) to right (action plans panel).
You can also click these tabs to take you directly to a specific part of the system.

legs.title: Overview tab
paragraphs: We're currently on the overview tab. Let's take a look around...

legs.title: Actions
paragraphs: The key thing PINGR does that other software does not, is that it suggests actions you could take to improve care. These actions always appear on the left hand side of the screen.
You always see the top 3 suggested actions, but if there are more than that there will be a link at the bottom of the list that says 'Show more than top 3 actions'.

legs.title: Actions - continued
paragraphs: The actions on the overview tab are things you can do at practice level and are based on your practice's data, NICE guidelines and the wider scientific literature.

The actions suggested by PINGR are only suggestions. You, the user, must decide whether or not they should be carried out in practice. Although they are based on NICE guidelines and we take into account each individual patient’s situation (e.g. PINGR doesn’t suggest starting a medication that a patient is allergic to), they may be incorrect, for example if key information is missing from the patient record.

legs.title: Agree/Disagree
paragraphs: If you agree with a suggested action, you can click the . This will save it to your action plans tab (more on that later). It will also tell PINGR that it has made a good suggestion, which will help improve it.

If you disagree with a suggested action, you can click the . You can then say why you disagree (though you don’t have to!). This will then remove the action so you don’t see it again, and also help PINGR improve the suggestions it makes (because it then knows what it’s done wrong).

legs.title: Add your own actions
paragraphs: You can also add your own actions if there are things you think need to happen but PINGR hasn’t suggested. These can then be shown to others as a way of sharing best practice in Salford.

legs.title: Indicator table
paragraphs: The indicator table gives you information on how your practice is performing on particular key performance indicators (KPIs). These are split into Outcomes (e.g. the number of strokes in your practice) and Processes (e.g. the number of patients with controlled hypertension). You can choose which to look at by selecting the corresponding tab.
Please select the 'Process Indicators' tab before continuing.

legs.title: Process indicators
paragraphs: The process KPIs table has columns relating to: the clinical area, the indicator name, your current performance, the number of actioned patients (i.e. number of patients not meeting the indicator who have been actioned), the Salford target, top 10% benchmark (i.e. the average score of the top 10% of practices in Salford), your change in score from yesterday, and 1 year trend.
All columns can be ordered by clicking the arrows next to them.

legs.title: Process indicators
paragraphs: The ‘Show more’ link gives you more information on the KPI and links to further evidence e.g. NICE guidelines or BMJ articles.
To view patients not meeting the KPI, simply click on the KPI and it will take you to the Indicator tab. Please do this now to continue the tutorial.

legs.title: Indicator tab
paragraphs: We're now on the indicator tab which lists the patients not achieving KPIs.

legs.title: Actions
paragraphs: The actions on this tab relate to the currently selected KPI, and are things you can do as a practice.
Remember to use the button when you agree, and the button when you disagree with a suggested action.

legs.title: Patient list
paragraphs: Here are all the patients not meeting the KPI.
There are orange buttons next to each NHS number you can click to copy. You can then paste this number into EMIS or Vision to find the patient by pressing ‘Ctrl’ and ‘v’ on your keyboard.
The list can be ordered, again by clicking the arrows according to a number of different columns, including patient age, and next annual review date

legs.title: Download
paragraphs: This list can be downloaded by clicking this button in order to be shared with others or printed. Beware this will include NHS numbers.

legs.title: Charts
paragraphs: This bar chart groups patients in the list into categories associated with different actions. Hover over the bars to see what they mean. Click the bars to filter the patient list below to patients with only that action (the coloured boxes in the list indicate what actions are relevant to each patient).

legs.title: Trend and comparison
paragraphs: Your current and future trend and comparison to other practices on this KPI can be accessed by clicking on the other tabs.

legs.title: Select a patient
paragraphs: To see information on an individual patient not meeting the KPI, simply click on the patient in the list and it will take you to the Patient tab.
Please do this now to continue the tutorial.

legs.title: Patient tab
paragraphs: We're now on the patient tab which provides information on individual patients.

legs.title: Actions
paragraphs: The actions on this tab relate to the currently selected patient. Remember you always see the top 3 suggested actions. If there are more than that click the link at the bottom that says 'Show more than top 3 actions'.
And once more... let PINGR know if you agree or disagree with its suggested actions by clicking or .

legs.title: Codes
paragraphs: If PINGR suggests a particular code to use, there is an orange button next to the code you can click to copy. You can then paste this code into EMIS or Vision by pressing ‘Ctrl’ and ‘v’ on your keyboard.
You can see why PINGR has suggested a particular action by clicking the link that says 'show more'. This may include links to NICE guidelines and other helpful information e.g. patient leaflets.

legs.title: Timeline
paragraphs: This timeline shows a patient's diagnoses, contacts with your practice, measurements, and medications. Hover over each point to get more information.
Because PINGR gets data from the Salford Integrated Record (SIR), this will also include information from the hospital too.

legs.title: Patient KPIs
paragraphs: This table shows all KPIs the patient is meeting or not.
There is a red exclude button to remove the patient from that KPI in PINGR (this won't remove them from any QOF indicators though).
You can display actions for all or just one KPI by clicking the button to the left of 'exclude'. (NB. This is only visible when there is more than one KPI for a patient)

legs.title: Copy NHS number
paragraphs: Again you can click this orange button to copy the NHS number. You can then paste this number into EMIS or Vision to find the patient by pressing ‘Ctrl’ and ‘v’ on your keyboard.

legs.title: View all patients
paragraphs: This gives a list of all patients in your practice ordered by the number of KPIs they are violating (so you can concentrate on patients who have the most ‘bang for your buck’).

legs.title: Patient search
paragraphs: You can search for patients according to their NHS number.

legs.title: Action plans tab
paragraphs: Let's go to the final tab.
Please click the Action Plans tab.

legs.title: Action plans tab
paragraphs: We're now on the action plans tab.

legs.title: Action plans
paragraphs: Here you will find all the actions you have clicked the for, or added yourself.
It also shows all the actions added by other members of staff in your practice, so you can build up a shared action plan.

legs.title: Download action plans
paragraphs: You can download this action plan as a PDF and share with other members of your practice, for example at a practice meeting.
Beware this includes NHS numbers.

legs.title: Send a comment
paragraphs: If there is anything you want to tell us such as problems with data or suggestions for how PINGR could be improved, please send them to us by clicking this button.
If you’re telling us about a specific patient or part of the system, don't worry, we’ll know what you mean because we know what page you’re on.
Please don’t put NHS numbers in your comments!

legs.title: User menu
paragraphs: You can change your password or email settings by clicking this link here.

legs.title: About us
paragraphs: If you want to find out more about PINGR, such as its methodology or the people who built it, click this link.

legs.title: The End
paragraphs: Thanks for taking the time to check out this tutorial.
Did we miss anything? If so let us know by using the 'Send a comment' button in the top right.
